titleStmt.title: Wit for money, or, Poet Stutter a dialogue between Smith, Johnson, and Poet Stutter : containing reflections on some late plays and particularly, on Love for money, or, The boarding school.
titleStmt.author: Brown, Thomas, 1663-1704.
Fidge, George.

notesStmt.note: Attributed by DNB to Thomas Brown, and by Wing to Thomas D'Urfey and George Fidge.

Items at reels 182:7 (Wing D2793, cancelled in Wing 2nd ed.), and 1112:3 (Wing CD-ROM W3136A) are reproductions of the Huntington Library copy, and contain ms. notes on t.p. and t.p. verso, and ms. addition "T.(hos) D.(urfey)" to dedication, which reads, "To Mr. T.D." The item at reel 1308:35 as Wing F856 (number cancelled in Wing 2nd ed.), is reproduced from British Library copy.
Reproduction of originals in the Huntington Library and the British Library.
